Engage

Public/Private Engagements

Speaker series, fellowships, and mentoring that pair mission leaders with practitioners. Designed to produce next-step actions and introductions.

I'm from government I'm from industry I'm a veteran I want to partner

Public/Private Engagements

Quarterly Speaker Series

Quarterly • In-person or virtual • Washington, D.C. & beyond

Candid discussions with senior leaders in government, defense, tech, and industry. Designed to produce next-step actions and introductions.

Who it's for

Senior leaders Operators Innovators

What you get

  • ✓ Curated speakers and closed-door exchange
  • ✓ Practical takeaways you can apply
Output: Curated introductions + actionable insights memos
Request a convening We'll respond within 3 business days

Bi-directional Fellowship

National Security Fellowship

6–12 months • Hybrid • Flexible location

Two-way placement between government and industry professionals. Each placement ends with a written deliverable and a briefing to stakeholders.

Who it's for

Government professionals Industry leaders

What you get

  • ✓ Immersion in each other's environments
  • ✓ Trust-building through mission work
Output: Written deliverable + stakeholder briefing
Apply for the fellowship Applications reviewed monthly

Career Transition Support

Veteran Mentoring

Ongoing • Virtual + In-person • Nationwide

Translate your military experience into meaningful civilian impact. Start with resume support, then connect with executive mentors who guide your transition.

Who it's for

Veterans Executive teams

What you get

  • ✓ Professional resume via Operation MOS
  • ✓ 1:1 mentorship from industry executives
Output: Polished resume + executive introductions
Start with your resume → Or request mentoring directly

Featured Initiative

Veteran Mentoring

Translate your military experience into meaningful civilian impact. Start by building your resume on Operation MOS, then connect with mentors who can guide your transition.

Eligibility Requirements

  • ✓ Honorably discharged U.S. military veteran
  • ✓ Minimum 4 years of active duty service
  • ✓ Interest in national security or public service
  • ✓ Commitment to ethics-first collaboration
Build your resume on Operation MOS →

Free, AI-powered resume builder designed specifically for veterans.

How to Engage

A straightforward path from initial contact to active collaboration.

1

Connect

Reach out to discuss your goals and explore how we might work together.

2

Discover

We'll identify the right program and format for your needs and objectives.

3

Collaborate

Engage in structured programs designed for trust, clarity, and measurable outcomes.

Propose an engagement

Frequently Asked Questions

Who can participate in Spades Institute programs?

Our programs are designed for professionals in government, industry, and academia who are committed to strengthening national security through ethical collaboration. We welcome senior leaders, operators, innovators, veterans, and researchers.

What's the time commitment for a fellowship?

Fellowship programs typically run 6-12 months and involve immersion experiences in partner organizations. The exact commitment varies based on the specific program and participant availability.

How are speaker series topics selected?

Topics are curated based on timely national security challenges and participant input. We focus on actionable insights that participants can apply to their work immediately.

Is there a cost to participate?

Program costs vary. Many of our programs are funded through partnerships and grants. Contact us to discuss specific opportunities and any associated costs.
